markdown: PROJECT ASSIGNMENT FORM NAME: Trina Ricci, PhD 18 Oak Grove Road Caldwell, NJ 07006 PROJECT: #8700; "Hormone Replacement Therapy but not Raloxifene Improves Endothelial Function in Postmenopausal Women with Increased Cardiovascular Risk" manuscript edit. DESCRIPTION: Write 8- to 10-page manuscript (not including references) based on the materials provided by the first author (G. Rosano). Points to Include Emphasize the positive benefits of CEE over raloxifene; include the points made by Michele Curtis in her review article indicating that SERMs are not a viable alternative to HRT; provide support that endothelial dysfunction is an important determinant of CVD (if possible). References DesignWrite will provide reference materials; however, the writer is not prohibited from using other suitable references. If additional reference materials need to be ordered, please request them through DesignWrite. Writer will provide highlighted references along with the manuscript, and all reference materials provided to the writer, including those left unused, will be returned to DesignWrite upon completion of the assignment. Timetable Work will begin on Tuesday, June 26, 2001, upon receipt of instructions and any materials provided by DesignWrite. Due date of the full draft of the manuscript is July 13, 2001. When revisions to the manuscript are required, they will need to be made extremely rapidly. DesignWrite will make every effort to alert the writer as to when comments/requests for revisions are expected; however, we may not be able to give prior notice at all times. Deadlines must be strictly observed. Failure to meet deadlines may result in financial penalties. <::attestation: Exhibit Stamp Stamped Readable Text: EXHIBIT, PENGAD-Bayonne, N. J., M78 A rectangular stamp with rounded corners and a thick black border, containing the word "EXHIBIT" at the top, "PENGAD-Bayonne, N. J." vertically along the left edge, and "M78" handwritten in the center with an underline.::> DWRITE 067815 Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/ymvw0217
